Text: Today: Protestors in Jerusalem block the road, demanding an end to the genocide in Gaza and chanting: "Security will not be achieved on the corpses of children "

Today in Jerusalem: Demonstration against the genocide in Gaza. Protesters were calling for Israeli soldiers to refuse service and to end the assault. The protesters were harassed by people on the street and beaten by police. 
@FreeJerusalem1

"Ofer-Ziv is now among over 100 Israeli servicemen and women who have signed a petition addressed to PM  Netanyahu, refusing to return to service without an immediate ceasefire deal in Gaza and return of the Israeli hostages who remain there."

In interview with Aljazeera English, conscientious objector Michael Ofer Ziv talks about the latest refusal initiative aimed at releasing the hostages and ending the war. He also recounts the indiscriminate violence he witnessed in Gaza.

Today in the Palestinian village of Burqa, near Ramallah, soldiers prevented the olive harvest by using stun grenades and making threats. As the soldiers attempted to evict the locals, masked settlers armed with batons approached.

Now: Protestors in Jerusalem are demending an end to the massacre in Gaza. Calling "How many more need to suffer? Human life above all!"

Israel is committing extermination in Jabalia—massacre after massacre. I have nothing more to add. I’ve been writing, talking, and screaming, but there are no words left, not in the way the cliché suggests, but literally. Entire families are being wiped out. Shame on all of us.

On Saturday Palestinians in at least three villages across the West Bank faced attacks by settler militias aimed at their displacement. Not one of the raiders was arrested.
The residetns of Zanuta, a Palestinian village in the West Bank, were finally able to return to their land after esceping because of violence and threts from settlers.

Skin diseases are running rampant in Gaza due to the  the appalling conditions in the overcrowded tent camps. Doctors are wrestling with more than 103,000 cases of lice and scabies and 65,000 cases of skin rashes, according to the WHO.

Sde Teiman is an obscenity in such plain sight that it is forcing a reckoning among many Israelis and supporters of Israel: A doctor at the facility said after seeing the abused detainee that he "couldn't believe an Israeli jailer could do such a thing."

This is what happens when you toe the Israeli line on war crimes: "today, I realized how much I was lied to...they [my Israeli sources] finally said the truth. That Israel is routinely torturing inmates. That sexual abuse is fairly common there [at Sde Teiman]"

The testomonies in this article are chilling: Israeli soldiers describe the near-total absence of firing regulations in the Gaza war, with troops shooting as they please, setting homes ablaze, and leaving corpses on the streets.

“Near the army compound between the northern and southern Gaza Strip, we saw about 10 bodies shot in the head, apparently by a sniper, [seemingly while] trying to return to the north. The bodies were decomposing; there were dogs and cats around them.”

“We were in a small area. Every day, at least one or two [civilians] are killed [because] they walked in a no-go area. I don’t know who is a terrorist and who is not, but most of them did not carry weapons.”
